thread.title: Uber trial starts in France with 2 executives charged
thread.title_full: Uber trial starts in France with 2 executives charged

author: LORI HINNANT
title: Uber trial starts in France with 2 executives charged
text:
Michel Euler Uber trial starts in France with 2 executives charged 
Pierre-Dimitri Gore-Coty, general manager for western Europe of California-based Uber, left, and Thibaud Simphal, manager of Uber France, right arrive at the court house in Paris, France, Wednesday, Sept. 30, 2015. Two Uber executives are facing the possibility of prison in a trial hinging on the ride-hailing service's outlawed low-cost service. The trial Wednesday of Pierre-Dimitri Gore-Coty and Thibaud Simphal, comes a week after France's top constitutional authority upheld a 2014 law banning the low-cost UberPop service, which allowed any driver to act as a taxi. Uber's standard app-based service remains legal in France. (AP Photo/Michel Euler) Michel Euler Uber trial starts in France with 2 executives charged 
Thibaud Simphal, manager for France of California-based Uber, arrives at the court house in Paris, France, Wednesday, Sept. 30, 2015. Two Uber executives are facing the possibility of prison in a trial hinging on the ride-hailing service's outlawed low-cost service. The trial Wednesday of Pierre-Dimitri Gore-Coty and Thibaud Simphal, comes a week after France's top constitutional authority upheld a 2014 law banning the low-cost UberPop service, which allowed any driver to act as a taxi. Uber's standard app-based service remains legal in France. (AP Photo/Michel Euler) Michel Euler Uber trial starts in France with 2 executives charged 
Pierre-Dimitri Gore-Coty, general manager for western Europe of California-based Uber, arrives at the court house in Paris, France, Wednesday, Sept. 30, 2015. Two Uber executives are facing the possibility of prison in a trial hinging on the ride-hailing service's outlawed low-cost service. The trial Wednesday of Pierre-Dimitri Gore-Coty and Thibaud Simphal, comes a week after France's top constitutional authority upheld a 2014 law banning the low-cost UberPop service, which allowed any driver to act as a taxi. Uber's standard app-based service remains legal in France. (AP Photo/Michel Euler) Posted: Wednesday, September 30, 2015 5:42 am | Updated: 8:00 am, Wed Sep 30, 2015. Uber trial starts in France with 2 executives charged Associated Press | 0 comments 
PARIS (AP) — Two European Uber executives are facing the possibility of prison in a French trial hinging on the ride-hailing service's lowest-cost service. 
While that service has already been banned in France, the trial that started Wednesday reflects larger tensions in Europe about how to regulate new technologies that offer consumers greater options but threaten traditional industries. kAm%96 EC:2= 4@>6D 2 H66< 27E6C uC2?46VD E@A 4@?DE:EFE:@?2= 2FE9@C:EJ FA96=5 2 a_`c =2H 32??:?8 E96 =@H\4@DE &36C!@A D6CG:46[ H9:49 2==@H65 2?J 5C:G6C H:E9@FE 2 AC@76DD:@?2= =:46?D6 E@ 5C:G6 A2DD6?86CD 2C@F?5 7@C 2 766] &36CVD DE2?52C5 2AA\32D65 D6CG:46[ H9:49 :?G@=G6D C68:DE6C65 5C:G6CD[ C6>2:?D =682= :? uC2?46]k^Am kAm&36C uC2?46 49:67 %9:32F5 $:>A92= 2?5 :ED 86?6C2= >2?286C 7@C (6DE6C? tFC@A6[ !:6CC6\s:>:EC: v@C6\r@EJ[ 7246 FA E@ EH@ J62CD :?
